billEvents.eventText: REFERRED TO COMMERCE, ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT AND SMALL BUSINESS

title: Requires that a regulatory impact statement be accompanied with proof of legislative approval
summary: Requires that a regulatory impact statement containing projected costs for a proposed regulation be accompanied with proof of legislative approval prior to filing the regulation with the secretary of state.
currentCommittee: COMMERCE, ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT AND SMALL BUSINESS
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         2096

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                   I N  S E N A T E

                                   January 18, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by  Sen.  KRUGER -- read twice and ordered printed, and when
         printed to be committed to the Committee on Commerce, Economic  Devel-
         opment and Small Business

       AN  ACT  to amend the state administrative procedure act, in relation to
         requiring that a regulatory impact statement be accompanied with proof
         of legislative approval

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section  1. Section 202-a of the state administrative procedure act is
    2  amended by adding a new subdivision 3-a to read as follows:
    3    3-A. ANY REGULATORY IMPACT STATEMENT CONTAINING PROJECTED COSTS FOR  A
    4  PROPOSED  REGULATION,  SHALL  BE  ACCOMPANIED  WITH PROOF OF LEGISLATIVE
    5  APPROVAL PRIOR TO FILING SUCH REGULATION WITH THE  SECRETARY  OF  STATE.
    6  SUCH PROOF SHALL CONSIST OF A CERTIFIED COPY OF A FLOOR VOTE SUPPLIED BY
    7  THE  CLERK  OF  THE  ASSEMBLY  OR  THE SECRETARY OF THE SENATE FOR THEIR
    8  RESPECTIVE HOUSES DEMONSTRATING A MAJORITY OF THE MEMBERSHIP  VOTING  IN
    9  THE AFFIRMATIVE FOR THE ADOPTION OF THE PROPOSED REGULATION.
   10    S 2. This act shall take effect immediately.





        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD06995-01-1
actClause: AN ACT to amend the state administrative procedure act, in relation to requiring that a regulatory impact statement be accompanied with proof of legislative approval
